website_summaries.verdict: Versatile, good-looking, and fast enough for most applications, the Buffalo MiniStation Thunderbolt HD-PATU3 makes an excellent buy for those looking for a portable Thunderbolt storage device.
pros: The bus-powered and affordable Buffalo MiniStation Thunderbolt HD-PATU3 drive offers fast performance via both Thunderbolt and USB and includes both a USB and a Thunderbolt cable
cons: The Buffalo MiniStation comes with just one Thunderbolt port

customer_reviews.title: Yet another technical item with instructions that aren't correct
customer_reviews.text: UGH! I'm frustrated with technical products for which the directions aren't correct or precise. The drive is NOT configured for a MAC (as some reviews said) you must configure it yourself, and the instructions don't map step by step nor do they give explanation for the options one can select. I tried to call the 800 number, but there was not help option. A patient young woman from Amazon tried to help me, but nothing worked. Extremely frustrating!
customer_reviews.author: bbg - virgina

customer_reviews.title: This is such a waste to have bought from them because I specifically bought ...
customer_reviews.text: This is such a waste to have bought from them because I specifically bought it so that I could use it for Thunderbolt capability, but it dismounts randomly whenever I'm using Thunderbolt. I have to use USB 3 which I could have easily bought a cheaper and better USB 3 drive if that was what I was wanting. Do not purchase from them. A complete waste of money and they won't give me an opportunity to get it replaced or refunded.
customer_reviews.author: lucas breaux

customer_reviews.title: Not for mac's
customer_reviews.text: This product claimed to work with macs but it does not. I can get the computer to SEE it through thunderbolt connection but mac doesn't recognize it as a "valid disk" to back up to, even after formatting it. I tried EXfat and Mac OS journal and turned on Time Machine and it just keeps saying No disks are available to back up even though it shows in the list of available disks. You also can't remove it from the exclusionary list (why it automatically gets put there after formatting is beyond me) because it is greyed out. So I will be returning this item and find one that actually works with a Mac.
customer_reviews.author: Jodie Fisher

customer_reviews.title: Very quiet small Thunderbolt 2GB HD - Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Very Quiet 2GB Thunderbolt External HD... much faster than the 3.0 USB drive it replaced. Smaller than I expected... perfect color to match my iMac. Only drawback is that it can’t be daisy-chained. Love this little thing
customer_reviews.author: Bluedog54

customer_reviews.title: WARNING:  Old Thunderbolt cable and plug type
customer_reviews.text: If you have a modern Windows PC with Thunderbolt 3 the supplied cable will not work. They have a flier in the box stating that the Thunderbolt is for older Apple with Thunderbolt 2, which has a completely different plug on the end of the cable. They state you should use USB if you have a PC running Microsoft Windows. I returned as there are less expensive solutions that use USB.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Poor USB3 Shielding
customer_reviews.text: The drive is poorly shielded and their USB 3 cable can be best described as not shielded. Otherwise the drive is well made, though I have no idea who manufactures the hard drive within... In short when using this drive with its USB3 interface use of BlueTooth devices in the local area is basically impossible given poor shielding thus RF interface. That said the Thunderbolt interface with very well. Perhaps if you are going to use this drive for exclusive USB3 then there is no reason to purchase this exact model...
customer_reviews.author: Wingo

customer_reviews.title: Very good! No words!
customer_reviews.text: Let's say: This is a dream box! Really good product. For Apple Mac user this is the one that you have to get! Thanks a lot for such a nice product!
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Must Have for 2012 to 2015 or so Macs

customer_reviews.title: Good rating by Tech Radar

Unfortunately Buffalo wasn't that helpful, but they were ready to have it sent back under warranty to analyse it. I still use it, but as a backup unit only.

customer_reviews.author: Harvey L.

customer_reviews.title: It is no faster than a USB 3 drive, ...
customer_reviews.text: It is no faster than a USB 3 drive, but it does come with a Thunderbolt port and cable. I have been using either the 1 TB or 2 TB version of this drive. They are comparable to Western Digital or Seagate and similarly reliable, but it is cheaper just to buy a USB3 drive if you don't need to connect it to your Thunderbolt port. I use it because it gives me a free USB3 port on my MacBook Pros or MacBook Air
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Drive does not mount
customer_reviews.text: I got this drive despite some negative reviews I found on line. The unit's thunderbolt port (or cable, I don't know) did not work. When I connected the drive to my display through the thunderbolt port the connection between the display and my computer was broken causing the display to turn off. I tried connecting directly to my computer but the drive did not mount. Curiously, I tried connecting through USB and none of this happened. Very strange. I don't think that this is a reliable product, neither will trust to put my data in it. The two start are because the encase is well designed and attractive, it matches apple products very well.
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: Very nice little beast
customer_reviews.text: Amazingly quiet compared to other enclosures, fast enough for 5400 RPM - 140 MB/s read, 130 MBP/s write over Thunderbolt on MacBook Pro mid-2012 13”.
customer_reviews.author: Ivan Chatilov

customer_reviews.title: Backup worth every penny
customer_reviews.text: A bit comparatively heavy unit, but well built in an solid metal casing., and important feature for heavy travelers. The thunderbolt cable heats up while is use, but this is common to all such cables. I backed up my computer (disk image) within 27 minutes - and I'm a heavy user. The USB cable might came in handy some day as well. My only suggestion is that the manufacturer include a convenient carrying bag for their excellent product - such quality deserves a worthy bag. If I ever get another external disk, Buffalo will definitely be my first consideration.
customer_reviews.author: Baruch Maoz

customer_reviews.title: Good low end Thunderbolt disk
customer_reviews.text: You're really not expecting miracles from $170 Thunderbolt drive which comes with a bundled cable, are you? I'm not. For a backup drive that quietly sits on the back of my iMac most of the time it works pretty good PROS: - price - included cable CONS - the look (a bulky soapbox, nah...) could be better - disk speed (you expected it to be comparable to SSD, right?) OVERALL Better than a USB drive and not as expensive as full-featured Thunderbolt storage solutions.
customer_reviews.author: John Doe

customer_reviews.title: MacMini's
customer_reviews.text: Buyer beware, Doesn't work "thunderbolt" port on MacMini 2010 (About Mac system report shows "thunderbolt" port, but its actually only a mini display port). Go with an external FW800 drive w/7200 rpms and you will be happy. search Apple's KB articles for thurnderbolt compatiblity before you buy. Even if I had a newer mac mini though, the internal drive on the Buffalo is only spinning at 5400 rpm and of course wont soak up all that "10Gbp/s" bandwidth, so cost for the speed isn't there - reason for 3 star rating.
customer_reviews.author: BL

customer_reviews.title: Ministation + Sandisk SSD
customer_reviews.text: I installed a Sandisk Extreme II 480GB SSD into this ministation. With some patience it's not too hard to open the ministation and swap the drives. The ministation will run warm to the touch with this SSD installed. The ministation COMES WITH a very short 17" long thunderbolt cable. After installation, I ran Black Magic disk benchmark. READ 384 MB/s WRITE 357 MB/s I'm happy with the write performance but not sure why the read performance isn't faster on my iMac i7 3.4Ghz.
customer_reviews.author: L. Arthur

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Works perfectly out of the box. Thunderbolt cable a bit touchy and disconnects unexpectedly when moving the HD around after it has been connected to the computer. Runs a little on the warm side.
customer_reviews.author: Glenn

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: Love this small drive. Small, quite, extremely fast, sleek, and all powered through the Thunderbolt port to boot. It was basically plug it in and it works. Love it! I know some people comment it does not have another Thunderbolt port on the back to daisy chain, but if you are a road warrior you don't want to be daisy chaining a series of things to drag around it is perfect. For photography buffs, this is a great drive to through into your backpack to hold all of your Aperture or Lightroom libraries. Buffalo did a great job in my opinion!
customer_reviews.author: Tim Melander

customer_reviews.title: My Review
customer_reviews.text: I bought this harddrive not for its intended use. I opened up this unit and put in an SSD to be the boot drive for my iMac. I realize the warranty was null and void as soon as I started, but, it all worked fine. My iMac now boots up in mere seconds with this unit utilizing the Thunderbolt connector on my iMac. I have nothing but 5 stars to say about this. I am now using the 1 terabyte hard drive that came with this unit in my ps3.

customer_reviews.title: Buyers remorse

Since this device only has one thunderbolt port it is the only thunderbolt device that I can run while using it. This is simply poor design and I wish I had never purchased it.

I think it works great for running basic Windows programs and using it to store movies and other files. Having an SSD I am a bit used to the speed, and so I notice a dip when I'm running programs in Windows off of it, but it's not bad at all.

Oh well, maybe I will put in an SSD when the higher capacity versions come down in price.

customer_reviews.title: Overblown specs
customer_reviews.text: Don't believe the 10GB/sec rating. But all the disk manufacturers do this. Unless you have a speedy RAID array, you're not going to get much more than 5GB/sec out of a rotating disk array like this. Otherwise, it's a huge amount of data in a small package, and, hey, who needs more than 5GB/sec anyway?

customer_reviews.title: WIthstands heavy loads, well designed, practical

The drive gets hot, but seems to be working just fine. Two included cables (Thinderbolt and USB3.0) are nice and short. I did not have a good experience with Buffalo before, but this drive has changed my mind - well designed, good looking, very practical product (if you are on Mac), designed by thoughtful people.

customer_reviews.title: Fair priced thunderbolt back up drive

customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Fraudulent
customer_reviews.text: The internal drive may only be 5400 RPM and thus you get no better performance that you would with USB3.0. Essentially, you are paying about $100 extra than alternatives for a Thunderbolt connection that will not give you any performance because internal drive is not fast enough to go beyond what USB 3.0 offers anyhow. Using clocking tools like ATTO or HD Tune will show the performance of the drive to be around roughly 80 MB/s read speeds with either Thunderbolt or USB 3.0. Thus the advertisements regarding performance are misleading, if not borderline fraudulent. I would really be concerned about a company that stoops to this low level to sell a product...
customer_reviews.author: TheRealDarknerd

product_meta.description: Size:1 TBMinistation Thunderbolt is a high performance portable hard drive featuring the revolutionary Thunderbolt technology. Delivering the fastest interface speeds available, up to 10 Gbps, Thunderbolt is 2x faster than USB 3. 0, giving you the fastest portable storage interface ever, Perfect for creative professionals and multimedia enthusiasts. Housed in a sleek aluminum body, MiniStation Thunderbolt is a stylish storage companion for your laptop while on the go and at home. It includes a USB 3. 0 port for convenience and universal connectivity. Instantly add capacity to your Mac or PC computer and use with time Machine to back up and protect your important data. Its bus-powered interface requires no additional cables so transporting your data is hassle-free. Ministation Thunderbolt is a complete portable Thunderbolt storage solution, Simply plug it in to any available Thunderbolt or USB port on your Mac or PC computer and securely store files to take on the road.
